intro: Galloa trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined galloa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three main veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Galloa trinervis is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins.
